intro: Hesperonia bigelovii, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Its leaves are typically small and fleshy, which helps reduce water loss. Hesperonia bigelovii is often found in rocky soils and is a member of the Malvaceae family.
